markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs=""
>
[The Tangled Briar](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2515)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Stolen Fate</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Artifact" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=253" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #191: The Destiny War](/Sources.aspx?ID=199) pg. 78

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** carried

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_The Tangled Briar_ signifies the return of ancient triumphs. As long as you have _The Tangled Briar_ invested, you gain [Toughness](/Feats.aspx?ID=855) as a bonus feat. If you already possess this feat, increase your maximum Hit Points by twice your level.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> envision, Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You raise the card up above your head and invoke the thorns and briars of the tangled parts of the world; you cast [_wall of thorns_](/Spells.aspx?ID=366). The level of the spell is half your level, rounded down (minimum 6th level). The brambles within this particular wall of thorns are treated as greater difficult terrain.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: The Tangled Briar
